TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ComponentConverter extends System.ComponentModel.ReferenceConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert components to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetPropertiesSupported%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentConverter.GetProperties%2A> by returning the properties through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
This converter converts an object that implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> and displays its properties in the Properties window.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A that represents the type to associate with this component converter.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object value, Attribute[] attributes);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object value, class System.Attribute[] attributes) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetProperties (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, value As Object, attributes As Attribute()) As PropertyDescriptorCollection

public: override System::ComponentModel::PropertyDescriptorCollection ^ GetProperties(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, System::Object ^ value, cli::array <Attribute ^> ^ attributes);

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
An that specifies the type of component to get the properties for.
An array of type that will be used as a filter.
Docs.summary: Gets a collection of properties for the type of component specified by the value parameter.
Docs.returns: A with the properties that are exposed for the component, or if there are no properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
The `attributes` array will be used to filter the array. The `attributes` can have a mix of <xref:System.Type> and <xref:System.Attribute> objects. Filtering is defined by the following rules:
- A <xref:System.Type> object will be treated as a wildcard; it will match any property that has the <xref:System.Type> in its set of attributes.
- If a property does not have an <xref:System.Attribute> of the same class, the property will not be included in the returned array.
- If the attribute is an instance of <xref:System.Attribute>, the property must be an exact match or it will not be included in the returned array.
- If a <xref:System.Attribute> instance is specified and it is the default property, it will be included in the returned array even if there is no instance of the <xref:System.Attribute> in the property.

Public Overrides Function GetPropertiesSupported (context As ITypeDescriptorContext) As Boolean

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object supports properties using the specified context.
Docs.returns: because should be called to find the properties of this object. This method never returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
